channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-10288] Cannot call permanent UDFs
item.description:
Just pulled the trunk and built the hive binary. If I create a permanent udf and exit the cli, and then open the cli and try calling the udf it fails with the exception below. However, the call succeeds if I call the udf right after registering the permanent udf (without exiting the cli). The call also succeeds with the apache-hive-1.0.0 release.

15-04-13 17:04:54,004 INFO  org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.log.PerfLogger (PerfLogger.java:PerfLogEnd(148)) - </PERFLOG method=parse start=1428969893115 end=1428969894004 duration=889 from=org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.Driver>

While reloading the permanent functions we need to add udf type (genericUDF/genericUDTF/genericUDAFResolver). Currently this information is not there, so it is throwing NullpointerException. To add udf type we have to load those resources to classpath.
Hi navis, Just added you because I see that the 'false' flag was introduced in HIVE-2573, so just wonder whether we break anything with this change.

Overall: -1 at least one tests failed

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12725251/HIVE-10288.patch

Tests exited with: TestsFailedException: 14 tests failed

This message is automatically generated.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12725251 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

The changes in patch v1 will cause Hive to preemptively load all permanent functions JARs during Hive initialization. Since HIVE-2573, Hive has been querying the metastore for permanent function information, which is something Navis pushed for with the argument that since we were not downloading the JARs it wouldn't be such a drag on Hive initialization. If we are loading the JARs now, then this may not be such a good thing.

There was supposed to be a mechanism in place where, if a permanent UDF was used in the current session, it would check if the JAR was loaded, and if it was not loaded, would download the JAR for the current Hive session. There must be something that is not working correctly here. If we can fix this mechanism that would be ideal, otherwise I think it might be better to skip the whole pre-emptive loading of permanent functions/JARs.
jdere The initialization is already slow even the jar files aren't downloaded, I have already opened a jira for that (HIVE-10319). When we start downloading the jars it will be much worse.

Ok. Yeah we can either try to improve the Hive metastore call (which it looks like you are doing) and fix the JAR loading mechanism, or just scrap the notion of pre-loading the permanent functions and simply register/load JARs as necessary when they are used in queries, which was the pre-HIVE-2573 behavior.

I think a new metastore call [proposed in HIVE-10319] to get all functions will also be useful in other contexts. AFAIK previously (on branch 1.0.0) org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.exec.FunctionRegistry.getFunctionNames() also used to get functions inefficiently hitting the same problem reported in HIVE-10319. So I guess we can go with the first option and fix the JAR loading mechanism.
I think I see the issue for this bug - when Hive.reloadFunctions() calls FunctionRegistry.registerPermanentFunction(), the function name should be qualified using FunctionUtils.qualifyFunctionName().

Hi jdere,nezihyigitbasi,

Thanks for the quick update on the patch. I have updated the patch. Please take a look.
